evidence.pdf_reference: a Thermo ESCALAB 250x. The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction, H 2 evolution by water splitting, and generation of OH radicals were adopted to evaluate the photocatalytic properties of obtained samples.The photoelectrochemical (PEC) properties were assessed by using prepared composites as photoanode materials for PEC water splitting.The detailed experimental conditions were included in the Supplementary Material.

g-C 3 N 4 due to the complex reaction kinetics (Bhosale et al., 2019;Ou et al., 2018).Therefore, for rational comparison with previous reports, we also used Pt as co-catalysts for H 2 evolution but not for CO 2 reduction.The optimal amount of acid-treated clay minerals in the composites was investigated from 400 to 700 mg.Based on the photocatalytic performance as shown in Fig. S4, S5, and S6, the CNK600, CNS500, and CNT500 were determined to be the representative samples.Moreover, a series of control

photocatalytic reactions.Upon illumination, the excited electrons in the conduction band of g-C 3 N 4 would reduce water or CO 2 to H 2 or CO, respectively, while the photogenerated holes in the valence band of g-C 3 N 4 would oxidize the sacrificial agents.Obviously, the clay mineral carriers would effectively facilitate the distribution and light-harvesting of g-C 3 N 4 , contributing to the enhanced photocatalytic performance.

4 in the composites, which can accelerate the charge transfer and impede the recombination of photoinduced electrons and holes. and better separation of photoinduced charge carriers as demonstrated by UV-Vis DRS (Fig. 5a) and PL (Fig. 6) results.In the same trend as photocatalytic CO 2 reduction and H 2 evolution, the CNK600 also shows the highest activity for the photocatalytic generation of OH radicals compared with the other composites, which may be attributed to its largest SSA. The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
